## About Me

I am a fifth year PhD candidate in Statistics at Northwestern. My
research focuses on causal inference and reliability for natural 
language processing. More specifically, my work creates a causally 
sufficient dimension reduction technique for text data and develops 
reliability metrics for natural language processing methods.

## Skills

- Machine Learning
- Natural Language Processing
- Causal Inference
- Reliability
- Statistical Modeling and Analysis
- Data Visualization
- Experimental Design
